meanings.definition: To rise or surge up like a wave.
meanings.sent1: The excitement made her heart spoom with joy.
meanings.sent2: The hot air balloon began to spoom into the sky.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter started to spoom out of the mixing bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to spoom through the room, infectious and joyful.
meanings.sent5: The rocket spoomed into space, leaving a trail of fire behind.

meanings.definition: A sudden or violent movement upwards.
meanings.sent1: The sudden spoom of the geyser startled the onlookers.
meanings.sent2: The spoom of the elevator took them by surprise.
meanings.sent3: The spoom of the popcorn kernels in the microwave was music to his ears.
meanings.sent4: The spoom of the volcano's eruption was both terrifying and mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The spoom of the fountain water caught the sunlight, creating a beautiful rainbow effect.

meanings.definition: A frothy mass or foam on the surface of a liquid.
meanings.sent1: The spoom on top of the cappuccino looked like a fluffy cloud.
meanings.sent2: The spoom of bubbles in the bath tickled her skin.
meanings.sent3: The spoom of the ocean waves carried tiny seashells to shore.
meanings.sent4: The spoom of the milkshake was the perfect finishing touch.
meanings.sent5: The spoom of the waterfall created a mesmerizing pattern as it cascaded down.
